meanings.definition: In a manner expressing protest or objection.
meanings.sent1: She shook her head remonstrantly when asked to do more chores.
meanings.sent2: He spoke remonstrantly about the unfair treatment of his classmates.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed remonstrantly when given a bath.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled remonstrantly against the closed windows.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's eyes glared remonstrantly at the misbehaving student.

meanings.sent1: Her remonstrantly tone made it clear she was not happy with the decision.
meanings.sent2: The audience's remonstrantly murmurs filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The dog gave a remonstrantly bark at the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds had a remonstrantly look as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: His remonstrantly expression showed his disapproval of the new policy.

meanings.sent1: The remonstrantly group refused to leave the park.
meanings.sent2: The remonstrantly students protested against the school's decision.
meanings.sent3: The toddler put up a remonstrantly fight against bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood remonstrantly against the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The workers held a remonstrantly strike for better wages.
